meanings.definition: The quality or state of being wicked
meanings.sent1: Her wickednesses were evident in her cruel actions towards others.
meanings.sent2: The town was plagued by the wickednesses of the corrupt officials.
meanings.sent3: Despite his wickednesses, he always had a mischievous twinkle in his eye.
meanings.sent4: The wickednesses of greed and envy consumed his soul like a raging fire.
meanings.sent5: The dark cloud of wickednesses loomed over the kingdom, casting a shadow on all.

meanings.sent1: The wickednesses of the villain knew no bounds.
meanings.sent2: The wickednesses of war brought suffering to many innocent people.
meanings.sent3: The wickednesses of the prank were revealed when the cake exploded.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of good versus evil, the wickednesses of the enemy were unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The wickednesses of the crime scene left a chilling feeling in the air.

meanings.sent1: The preacher warned against the wickednesses of temptation.
meanings.sent2: The wickednesses of dishonesty tarnished his reputation.
meanings.sent3: The wickednesses of skipping school seemed thrilling to the rebellious teen.
meanings.sent4: The wickednesses of betrayal cut deep, leaving scars that never healed.
meanings.sent5: The wickednesses of the forbidden fruit tempted Adam and Eve in the garden.
